slideInfo.title: What is the historical context of the information?

pButton.Name: SCRAMBLE
pButton.popInfo:
• Occurred in the late 19th and early 20th centuries
• Much of Asia was already colonized

pButton.Name: IMPERIALISM
pButton.popInfo:
• Nations which controlled colonies were called
empires
• Competition among nations to acquire more
colonies was intense

pButton.Name: MOTIVATIONS
pButton.popInfo:
• The need for raw materials and markets for the
expanding Industrial Revolution
• Nationalism
• A belief in the superiority of European civilization
• A feeling of duty for Europeans to spread the
benefits of their cultural, political, and economic
achievements to the ‘uncivilized’ parts of the world

• Held in 1885
• Called by Germany’s Chancellor Otto von Bismarck
• Purpose was to draft a code governing the way that
European powers should proceed to acquire
African territories
• Intended to avoid conflicts among European
powers during the Scramble for Africa
